metadata.title: CVE-2021-38508 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS. (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
By displaying a form validity message in the correct location at the sametime as a permission prompt (such as for geolocation), the validity messagecould have obscured the prompt, resulting in the user potentially beingtricked into granting the permission. This vulnerability affects Firefox <94, Thunderbird < 91.3, and Firefox ESR < 91.3.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38508` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 94.0+build3-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '94.0+build3-0ubuntu1').
thunderbird package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.3.1+build1-0ubuntu1').
